description: From Middle English smytinge, smitende, smytende, smitand, from Old English smītende, from Proto-Germanic *smītandz, present participle of Proto-Germanic *smītaną (“to throw, hurl, bespatter”), equivalent to smite +‎ -ing.
From Middle English smytinge, smytynge, equivalent to smite +‎ -ing.

entries.meaning: The act of one who smites.
examples: When her sisters talked about the Bible it was all the Sermon on the Mount and the Song of Solomon, Proverbs and Psalms; never smitings and plagues.
